comments:
I have implemented a headless version of my builder, and I am getting the
following, sporadically dumped to my console after Eclipse shuts down.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/core/internal/utils/StringPool
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.StringPoolJob.shareStrings(StringPoolJob.java:111)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.StringPoolJob.run(StringPoolJob.java:93)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)


I have no idea what is causing this.  There is nothing in the log file.  I am
saving the workspace before I exit, and I do not get any indication that the
workspace crashed the next time I start Eclipse (headless or full-GUI).

It occurs quite rarely, and I have no known way of reproducing it at this point
in time, but considering I am trying to make a command-line tool for my users,
this is rather ugly to see in your console after a build.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 100615 ***
